definition:
A set of vertices in a graph $G$ is called an [*independent set*]{} if
there are no edges between the vertices.

The [*independence number*]{} of a graph $G$, usually denoted by
$\alpha(G)$, is the size of a maximal independent set in $G$.
$\alpha(G) \geq \nu$ means that there are $\nu$ vertices with no edges
between them.

An independent set is sometimes called a stable set or an anticlique.
